greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes of the form x^2+8*x*y-8*y^2 (as well as of the form x^2+10*x*y+y^2).
comment: Conjecture: Same as A107008. - _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Jul 25 2012
x^2 + 8*x*y - 8*y^2 = (x+4*y)^2-24*y^2, and x^2+10*x*y+y^2 = (x+5*y)^2-24*y^2, so this sequence is also primes of the form x^2 - 24*y^2. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 05 2013
reference: Z. I. Borevich and I. R. Shafarevich. Number Theory. Academic Press. 1966.
D. B. Zagier, Zetafunktionen und quadratische Koerper.
link: N. J. A. Sloane et al., Binary Quadratic Forms and OEIS (Index to related sequences, programs, references)
results.author: Laura Caballero Fernandez, Lourdes Calvo Moguer, Maria Josefa Cano Marquez, Oscar Jesus Falcon Ganfornina and Sergio Garrido Morales (oscfalgan(AT)yahoo.es), Jun 28 2008
ext: More terms and offset corrected by _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Jul 25 2012
